questions.question: A project that satisfy time and cost objectives but fails to create value:
options: Project management success, but project failure
Failure in terms of both project management and project
questions.explanation: As project management success is about the project’s ability to satisfy the contextual and project constraints it will be considered a success if the time and cost objectives are withheld. Project success is about the project’s ability to create value and thereby it would be considered a failure if this was not achieved.

questions.question: A project that creates value to the client but fails to deliver on time or according to budget is a:
questions.explanation: This is a project success as it has created value, however a project management failure because the project did not stay within the constraints of the project.

questions.question: “Our goal is to deliver the project on time” is a:
questions.explanation: It is a success criterion as it describes the desired outcome of the project.

questions.question: “Our goal is to deliver the project with zero accidents” is a:
questions.explanation: It is a success criterion as it describes the desired outcome of the project.

questions.question: “Empowering project team members” could be described as:
questions.explanation: It is a success factor as it describes how the individuals in the project organization should act in order to achieve success.

questions.question: “We shall adhere to our commitments” is a:
questions.explanation: It is a success factor as it describes how the individuals in the project organization should act in order to achieve success.

questions.question: Achieving project management success is a prerequisite for achieving project success.
questions.explanation: Project management success is about the project’s ability to satisfy the contextual and project constraints, while project success is about the project’s ability to create value. As it is possible to satisfy one or the other this is false.

questions.question: Project management failure lead to project failure.
questions.explanation: Project management success is about the project’s ability to satisfy the contextual and project constraints, while project success is about the project’s ability to create value. As it is possible to satisfy one or the other this is false.

questions.question: The definition of success in project has changed from:
options: Being limited to the project life cycle to the entire life cycle of the product or service
Entailing the entire product life cycle to being limited to the project life cycle
Being limited to the project life cycle to entailing several projects completed by the same project organization
questions.explanation: There exist several models that describe and classify the success factors of the project several years after completion and from the views of various stakeholders.

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the four types of success according to Shenhar:
options: Business success for the parent organization

questions.question: The subjective approach of defining success criteria  assume that estimated time and cost of the project can be predicted in the beginning.
questions.explanation: This is an assumption of the objective approach.

questions.question: The objective approach of defining success criteria  assume that all stakeholders will have the perception of the project
questions.explanation: This assumption is true, and is the main difference between the objective and the subjective approach. More information can be found at p. 54 in Road to Success.

questions.question: The first researcher to propose the distinction between project management success and project success was:
questions.explanation: More information can be found at p. 55 in Road to Success.

questions.question: Wilson and Howcroft are important in project management literature as they:
options: Illustrated that the subjective evaluation of whether a project was a success or not is merely a way of legitimize the events of the project
Linked project management success to process success and established several guidelines for businesses to achieve these
questions.explanation: More information can be found at p. 55-58 in Road to Success. Cooke-Davis developed the model describing the success factor categories.

questions.question: Project success is about:
options: how certain stakeholders perceive project implementation phase.
the ability of the project to create value
satisfying various project and contextual constraints

questions.question: Process success is about:
options: how certain stakeholders perceive project implementation phase.
the ability of the project to create value.
satisfying various project and contextual constraints.

questions.question: Project management success is about:
options: how certain stakeholders perceive project implementation phase.
the ability of the project to create value
satisfying various project and contextual constraints

questions.question: A success factor is:
options: Measurable indicators used to assess project outcome
Ground rules we collect after completing the project
Activities that should be followed during project planning and execution

questions.question: Success criterion is:
options: Measurable indicators used to assess project outcome
Ground rules we collect after completing the project
Activities that should be followed during project planning and execution
